channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Willow tree has fallen down across path, 11th August
item.description:
A large willow tree has fallen down across the water link way foot/cycle path in the section between Catford and the wooden bridge where the Ravensbourne and the pool rivers meet, people and cyclist are walking under as there is about 2 metre clearance, not sure how safe this is. photo taken about 14:00 on 11th August.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vineyard Close, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic din, 11th August
item.description:
Can the council please make order with a closed lane in Southampton Row, near the junction with Theobalds Road. It has been coned off for weeks yet no work has been carried out. It causes huge traffic tailbacks, resulting in impatient drivers hooting their horns incessantly. Once one starts others follow like sheep. The racket goes on day and night, causing a tremendous disturbance to residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Row, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped fridge, 11th August
item.description:
This fridge was dumped last week outside the flats on Colbrooke Rise and has been there for nearly a week and hasn’t been collected. Please can this be collected ASAP as it will encourage further flytipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colebrook Rise, Shortlands, London

item.title: Street Weeds, 11th August
item.description:
Email received by CSC inbox 10/08/25 00:33 • Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: An overgrowth of weeds on my road, it’s been severely neglected and I would tackle it myself but don’t feel safe outside of the properties. The residents living aside from this neglect there surroundings further extending down the back which doesn’t help • What action (if any) would you like us to take? Some maintenance and clean up would be appreciated
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmcroft Way, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars and vans idling on Surrey Row, 11th August
item.description:
Cars and vans sit on Surrey Row idling for ages. I’ve noticed a huge problem this summer, since having the windows open all day. All I can hear for what seems like most of the day is people sat inside their idling cars. Please can you put up some signs or send enforcement officers around this way more.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Row, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident continuously dumping in front garden, 11th August
item.description:
Issue has persisted for months, this has attracted mosquitos leading to an increase of them in the area as the bins are a breeding ground and they fly into nearby adjacent windows. Dog poo bags, dirty bedding and rubbish all over the front garden of 53 Amina Way, this is attracting rats/mosquitos in the area, this behaviour is ridiculous given bins are provided and regularly collected for all Residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rouel Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nw5 4ex, 11th August
item.description:
Hello, thanks for your help Both street signs are very difficult to see at night which means if you are being collected or visited, people have difficulty finding the street particularly at night. This makes it difficult for those in the street with mobility issues or who require assistance. Is it possible for both signs to be re painted so they can be seen from both approaches please? There is nowhere else to report this to other than the council
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Thomas's Gardens, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Harassment dog fouling outside disabled access property., 11th August
item.description:
The property in question is adapted for a disabled person, who may have mobility or immunity vulnerabilities, making exposure to faecal matter a heightened health risk. Dog faeces carry Toxocara canis and other pathogens, posing serious risks including toxocariasis, which can cause blindness and other severe health effects. The deliberate or reckless fouling of this location may amount to harassment or discrimination under the Equality Act 2010 if it has the effect of degrading or endangering a disabled person. While I acknowledge that Bromley Council has recently sent cleaning staff to address the worst site on Byne Road, there has been no apparent preventative enforcement. This is allowing the nuisance to continue, with escalating seriousnes

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Studland Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Top of tree needs pruning., 11th August
item.description:
The top of the tree outside 9 and 11 Forster Road (BR3 4LH) needs pruning. The bottom of the tree has been pruned, but the top of the tree still touches the properties. The top of the tree should be pruned so that it doesn't touch the properties.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forster Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
